title: Kele Leawere
text:
Senikavika Kelemete Leawere (born 27 April 1974) is a <a href="Fiji">Fiji</a>an <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. He plays as a <a href="Lock%20%28rugby%20union%29">lock</a>.
Career.
He is the elder brother of former <a href="Fiji%20national%20rugby%20sevens%20team">Fiji sevens rep</a>, <a href="Mika%20Leawere">Mika Leawere</a> and <a href="Sekove%20Leawere">Sekove Leawere</a>. He departed for New Zealand in 1996 and has made an excellent name for himself in <a href="Heartland%20Championship">NPC Division Two</a> with <a href="East%20Coast%20Rugby%20Football%20Union">East Coast</a>, making 56 appearances and playing for the NZ Divisional XV against <a href="Italy%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Italy</a> and <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Ireland</a>. He also played for the <a href="Fiji%20Warriors">Fiji Warriors</a> against the <a href="Brumbies%20%28rugby%29">ACT Brumbies</a> in 1997. He played for Nadroga and also represented the <a href="Coastal%20Stallions">Coastal Stallions</a> in the <a href="Colonial%20Cup%20%28rugby%20union%29">Colonial Cup</a>.
In October 2002, Leawere flew to Fiji to attend the national trials and won selection for the tour to Britain and Ireland, making his Test debut as a replacement against <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a>. He scored his first test try in June 2004 when he twisted and turned his way through the <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Samoan</a> defense in <a href="Suva">Suva</a>. He was a member of the <a href="Fiji%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Fiji</a> team at the <a href="2003%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2003 Rugby World Cup</a>.
In May 2007, he was chosen to be part of <a href="Fiji%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Fiji team</a> for the <a href="2007%20Pacific%20Nations%20Cup">2007 Pacific Nations Cup</a> and later on co-captained the <a href="Fiji%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Fiji team</a> at the <a href="2007%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2007 Rugby World Cup</a>. In the 2007 World Cup he scored one of the tries as Fiji defeated <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales</a> to reach their first quarter final in 20 years. 
In August 2014, he joined the <a href="National%20Federation%20Party">National Federation Party</a> to contest in the upcoming <a href="2014%20Fijian%20general%20election">elections</a>.
